TopicTitle: Top Gun AI - The Official Tournament Thread

Articles.Content: The second round has now ended! Video will be up in an hour.

Just a quick question to Pixel, could you check sometime soon if my nosecone fuel flow is disabled? It is here for ballast and prevents spinning out of control. In the video from the first fight I've noticed that few times my plane apparently entered a flatspin for a few seconds which was happening after draining too much fuel from the nosecone. Also, my cocpkit torque might be on. It makes no difference at all (proved by testing) but just for the sake of it it should be off. Thanks and sorry for troubling you. C:
Looks like I'm up soon, and I'm facing an opponent armed only with cannons? This should be interesting.

> 
> Looks like I'm up soon, and I'm facing an opponent armed only with cannons? This should be interesting.

Missiles are next to useless in the fights. I'm considering making them 2 points.

> 
> Missiles are next to useless in the fights. I'm considering making them 2 points.

I disagree, actually. As demonstrated by the XMF (sorry for always using it as an example, but I see it as the most likely champion) a volley of missiles can be incredibly deadly and end the fight really quickly. It takes a lot to dodge that many at once, so it makes it a pretty solid tactic. IMO of course.
Hey pixel if you haven't yet could you set the scan interval to 1 on the subat. I didn't realize that the smaller the number the faster it shot missiles off. My bad

> 
> Missiles are next to useless in the fights. I'm considering making them 2 points.

In testing various airframe and weapon configurations, the vast majority of scored kills I got were from missiles. This included gimmick designs that tried to cram on as much dakka as possible - missile armed designs blew them out of the sky before they could close to gun range, although those that did manage to survive eviscerated the enemy plane with cannon fire.

It depends on how many countermeasure pods the opponent has. I've found that 4 pods defeats a volley of missiles most of the time.

I don't know though, maybe I'm wrong.

same here - 4 cm pods will negate the majority of missiles. If anything, putting a limit on CM pods or increasing their price might be the way to go. At present, 4 pods are only 20 points out of 60 available. If we had to actually make sacrifices in armament to have decent missile protection from CM pods, I think it would result in some interesting design philosophies emerging.

I was considering lowering missiles by maybe a point and raising coutermesures by a point or two when I made the thread, but decided to leave it open to input.

Personally, I would like to see less missile combat and more machinegun dog fighting.

By the way, good luck Suicidal Insanity! May your missiles fly true and your explosions be glorious.

I would like that too, however I want to allow people to design aircraft to their own advantages. Maybe I'll do a guns only tourney in the future.
